>From: Derek James <djames@...>
>Do you have any samples of enhancements
>by some of your better-performing ANNs that you could upload, to give
>us an idea of how well or poorly they're performing?

No, I don't.  I haven't written the code that does that yet.  I've been 
putting it off because I can tell by the fitness values that it isn't able 
to do much more than average its inputs, which is a far cry from 
enlargement.

Since I have so heavily modified the fitness evaluation, I decided to go 
ahead and restart the experiment.  My patience is not what it was, so I've 
cut the number of networks down to a maximum of 100 so I can get through the 
packets faster.  I want to see the generations tick by faster so I can have 
a better idea of how it's doing.  Of course, it doesn't explore as many 
topologies at once this way, so whether or not it is truly faster is 
arguable.

Another thing I have decided to do is to extend my training samples, sort 
of.  For each original image, I'm going to make a copy that is 1/2 the 
original size.  And another that is 1/3rd, 1/4th, and 1/5th.  That way, I 
know that the networks are being exposed too more than just gradients.  
Cross your fingers, let's hope that helps.  :)

-- John
